intro: Dorstenia erecta var. hispida, commonly known as the hairy false arum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant features palmate leaves with a rough, hairy texture, giving it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Dorstenia erecta var. hispida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
